Bolelli etÂ al. synthesised 2-substituted benzothiazoles by the reaction of carboxylic acid with thionyl chloride which afforded acyl chlorides, further treated with substituted benzothiazole to give 2-substituted benzothiazoles, which were studied for their inhibitory activities against human glutathione transferases (hGSTP1-1). The benzamide benzothiazole derivative 43 and benzamide methylbenzothiazole 44 ( Figure 26) showed potent hGSTP1-1 inhibitory activities, useful in cancer chemotherapy. The SAR studies pinpointed that both these scaffold showed effective inhibition due to the presence of para-substitutions on the phenyl ring of the benzamide group
47 .
